info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 1 at 11:56AM EDT until July 3 at 12:40PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Edwardsport.
White River at Petersburg.
White River at Hazleton.
.Rainfall amounts of 3 to 7 inches of rain fell across the area over the past few day. This will produce minor flooding along the White River near Edwardsport and points downstream in the coming days. River flooding should begin tonight and end by this weekend.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Petersburg.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to early Thursday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County roads. Many of the following county roads begin to flood around this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250 W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR 1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EDT Tuesday /10:30 AM CDT Tuesday/ the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 17.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 300 AM EDT /200 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Gibson, IN; Knox, IN; Pike, IN
